text: You're the closest I've come to a sunrise in human form.
Something about you makes everything else slow down.
You have the kind of presence people notice—even without trying.
You're like a pause button I didn't know I needed.
Things feel a little calmer when you're around.
You remind me that the best things don't shout.
You make it easy to believe in timing.
Some people sparkle—you glow.
You're a kind of quiet that doesn't feel empty.
You're the kind people write ridiculous love songs about.
There's something about your eyes that feels familiar—in the best way.
You remind me that real attraction starts with feeling safe.
You have a calm I could learn from.
It's hard not to smile when you do.
There's something very real about you—and it shows.
You're a reminder that people can be both beautiful and genuine.
You feel like coming home—without knowing why.
You're the best part of coincidence.
There's something effortlessly beautiful about you.
You're the quiet part in an otherwise noisy world.
You're like a good commit—small, but changes everything.
Zero bugs, just butterflies.
I thought I was stable, then you showed up and disrupted my entire code.
Are you an API? Because I want to connect to you 24/7.
You just spiked my heart rate like a stress test.
If we were an algorithm, we'd be optimized for attraction.
You're the unknown variable that makes my whole equation worth solving.
I tried debugging my feelings, then realized it's just you.
You must be a breakpoint, because you stop my train of thought completely.
Are you an input? Because every time you appear, I get output I wasn't prepared for.
You just overclocked my mental CPU.
I don't need AI to know you're a good choice.
You're like a perfect merge—everything fits.
Are you Wi-Fi? Because I feel connected just by seeing you.
Something about you triggers my whole system—in a good way.
I tried caching my feelings, but my heart updates in real time.
We'd make a solid pull request—compatible, clean, and a little hot.
You're the only bug I hope never gets fixed.
If love were a matrix, you'd be 1 in every dimension.
I don't know what code you're running, but you made me crash beautifully.
Your smile is a concentration test I never pass.
If I'm staring, it's only because I'm trying to understand how you're possible.
You make it unnecessarily hard to pretend I'm busy with anything else.
It's almost rude how good you look right now.
I don't think you realize how much chaos you cause in my head.
You should come with a 'do not get too attached' sign.
It shouldn't be legal to look that good and that unbothered at the same time.
You know it's not fair to look back at me like that, right?
You should probably be invoiced for all the thoughts you steal.
You're just enough to make me lose my train of thought.
You're borderline illegally charming—I should be taking notes.
You're the kind of person people pretend they didn't notice—and fail.
I tried holding eye contact, but my brain said nope.
You're proof that stealing attention is an actual thing.
You make it very hard to focus on what I was actually going to say.
Could you stop being so attractive? I'm trying to behave.
You look like a distraction I'll happily regret.
You're unsettlingly cute—it should count as trouble.
That smile is a warning sign in disguise.
I see why people lose focus around you. I'm one of them now.
You look like trouble I should definitely avoid—but won't.
Your eyes promise things the conversation won't dare to say.
Is this flirting, or are you just sabotaging my judgment?
You're not dangerous—but my thoughts are around you.
Something about you makes innocence feel… optional.
You're a distraction with side effects I don't want to avoid.
That smile? Straight into the category 'think twice—do it anyway.'
You have that look that makes staying in trouble sound reasonable.
My thoughts don't behave themselves when you're around.
You're a 'come here' without saying a word.
If looks could undress, I'd already be in trouble.
You have the lead role in my thoughts—and I'm considering a sequel.
Let's be honest—the chemistry here isn't exactly subtle.
You're not just cute—you're daydreams with consequences.
You make me think about everything except innocent things.
If attraction were a crime, I'd be an accomplice.
You're not just stealing my glance—you take the thoughts after, too.
You feel like a temptation disguised as coincidence.
You make me want to make bad decisions with excellent company.
You give the kind of energy that's impossible to ignore—or sleep through.
You have the kind of effect that turns a day around—without doing anything big.
Something about the way you are makes the world breathe easier.
You carry a natural steadiness about you—and it shows.
You're like the line that puts the whole book into perspective.
With you it feels real—really real.
Some people disrupt. You ground.
You have that rare presence that makes silence comfortable.
Your gaze feels like letting my shoulders drop a little.
You remind me how good it can feel to land somewhere—or in someone.
You're so calm it's almost easy to forget how intensely present you are.
Something about you makes everything feel a bit more real and a lot less rushed.
You have the kind of presence that makes time never feel wasted.
You're not just easy to be around—you’re hard to forget after.
You make the simple feel big.
There's something in your voice that makes everything less noisy.
You're the kind who does good without making a fuss about it.
The lovely thing about you is you’re not trying to be anything—you just are.
You have an effect that makes people think a little more with their heart.
Things land a little softer when you’re around.
You turn everyday moments into something worth remembering.
You're like a bug I don't want to fix—just stare at and be fascinated by.
Every time you show up, my whole system gets high latency.
You're like dark mode—suddenly everything’s more comfortable.
If looks could compile feelings, we'd be production ready.
I thought I had plenty of RAM until you overloaded my whole system.
You're like a dev environment spun up—and I'm so ready to test.
I didn’t know attraction could be triggered by syntax as clean as yours.
You make my thoughts as unstable as a badly written while-loop.
You're like a new feature in my life’s changelog.
Something about you feels like a perfect commit—tidy, thoughtful, exactly what's needed.
You're not just cute—you’re semantically correct and objectively attractive.
If we were a database, we’d have a beautiful relationship.
Are you a terminal? Because you’ve got full control over my input.
You just sent my brain into infinite recursion on ‘why are you so attractive?’
You’re like a token with unlimited access to my thoughts.
I thought I was async, but you make me respond synchronously—every time.
You just crashed my brain without warning.
You're more satisfying than a green test suite after a long night.
Are you a compiler? Because you make everything I'm trying to say clearer.
I didn’t know love could be expressed in binary—until I met you.
You’re the reason I forget what I was actually going to say.
You really should come with a side-effects warning.
You look like a compliment I shouldn’t say out loud—and I’m going to anyway.
You’re the kind of distraction I don’t want to avoid.
There should be a rule against being that cute and that hard to ignore.
It’s almost like you’re trying to throw me off balance. And it works.
You make it nearly impossible to pretend I have self-control.
You’re just the right amount of chaos to be tempting.
You’re the kind of look people pretend they didn’t notice—and never manage to.
You make it suspiciously easy to forget I used to be good at focusing.
I had a plan for the day; then you showed up and ruined it in the best way.
You’re like a tiny glitch in my system—and I love it.
You're the reason I have to rewrite the message—because I was staring first.
If you keep looking at me like that, I’ll have to report you to the flirt police.
You’re nowhere near discreet—and I love it.
I tried to look cool; then you showed up and wrecked it with that smile.
You have the kind of look that makes people start typing dumb messages. Like this one.
If this were a self-control test, I’d fail with style.
You make it seem like being a little inappropriate is a good idea.
Just so you know: I’m blaming you if my brain takes a lunch break next time we talk.
You have the kind of energy that makes me think about anything but small talk.
You make me want to invent bad excuses to stay a little longer.
You're not dangerous, but you make my thoughts that way.
Your look feels like an invitation with fine print I’m choosing to ignore.
You have the smile that makes me forget what’s wise.
You give the kind of look that isn’t about talking more.
You look like the reason I won’t sleep tonight.
We shouldn’t—but every part of me votes yes anyway.
It isn’t just your eyes that are intense—it’s everything about you.
You have the kind of pull that turns off reason and turns on everything else.
You don’t say much, but your body does more than enough talking.
I promise to be good… until you say otherwise.
You trigger impulses I usually keep in check. Usually.
You are the definition of that look that makes people lose clothes in their imagination.
If it’s you I’m thinking about right now, I should probably log off.
You’re not a distraction—you’re the whole reason for the spiral.
You make me wonder how quiet a room can get… and what happens after.
We don’t have to say much. We both know what this really is.
You’re not just hot—you’re ‘gotta think of something’ hot.
You give off the kind of energy that doesn’t belong in public.
